title: IGNITE-17046 Move H2RowComparator logic to the core module
body:
Changes description:
- Class `IndexKeyType` refactored to enum.
- Class `GridH2RowDescriptor` cleaned of H2 dependencies, renamed to `GridQueryRowDescriptor` and moved to the core module.
- Class `QueryIndexDefinition` cleaned of H2 dependencies and moved to the core module.
- Class `QueryIndexRowHandler` cleaned of H2 dependencies and moved to the core module.
- Class `H2RowComparator` removed, basic types comparison logic (compare between numeric types, compare between date types) moved to the `IndexRowCompartorImpl` class (this logic can be used by Index Query). To compare other types between each other (for example, strings with dates, etc) the new index key class created (`H2ValueIndexKey` class). This class use H2 to compare different types. H2 `Value` wrapped into this class during execution of index scan by H2.
- Some index related classes were moved from ignite-indexing to ignite-core without major changes.

body:

* New behavior can be disabled with `ClientConfiguration#autoBinaryConfigurationEnabled` to support legacy use cases.

title: IGNITE-17043 Shrink GridHandleTable on clear
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IGNITE-17043

WHAT:
Automatically shrink the size of GridHandleTable on `clear` by the factor of two. Shrink only in case if element count is less than table size / 2, so we don't actually shrink table if we have a lot of big lists, for example.

WHY:
GridHandleTable grows during marshalling and never shrinks. Which leads to very long clear operations if, for example, we marshal a very big list and after that we marshal a very small list. In this case GridHandleTable will grow to the size of the very big list and subsequent clear operations will take a long time on every small list.

title: IGNITE-17005 Implement metrics for a snapshot create operation
body:
The following metrics implemented:
**CurrentSnapshotTotalSize** - Estimated size of current cluster snapshot in bytes on this node. The value may grow during snapshotting.
**CurrentSnapshotProcessedSize** - Processed size of current cluster snapshot in bytes on this node.

CurrentSnapshotTotalSize (partitions + deltas during snapshot):

title: IGNITE-17029 PITR: Consistent Cut
body:
Consistent Cut is an algorithm for taking consistent distributed snapshot. The Cut is a point on timeline such that set of committed transactions before (after) this point is the same on every node in a cluster. Order of transactions matters: if one transaction (A) depends on previous one (B) - then (A) can't be before the Cut when (B) is after: [A, Cut, B]. Right orders of transactions: [B, A, Cut] or [B, Cut, A].

Transaction can be described as ordered sequence of events: messages between nodes (PrepareRequest, PrepareResponse, FinishRequest) and local TransactionStates. Correct order of events is well known, it depends on transaction algorithm (TwoPhaseCommit, OnePhaseCommit).

Goal is to track whether every event within single transaction on the same side (before or after) of the Cut. To achieve this: 
1. The messages between nodes are signed with latest known local Cut version.
2. On receiving message with new Cut version node has to handle new version before applying the message (start Consistent Cut procedure locally).
3. Consistent Cut procedure consist of steps: update local Cut version, find which transactions aren't awared of versions of previous events, write Cut info to WAL.
4. While receiving messages such transactions become aware of the versions. After all such transactions completed with known Cut version a node writes second Cut info to WAL.

This algorithm guarantees that every node has the same committed transactions before Cut in the same order.

More info in [IEP-89 PITR](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=211884314)
